property.description: Property sheet to hold XML specification for forms

formalParameter.description: Configuration Name
IP Address of JBoss AS.
Physical path to jboss-cli.
Additional JAVA_OPTS
Log level.
The configuration name that will be deleted
Provide the absolute physical path of the standalone script, i.e: 'standalone.bat', '/usr/tools/bin/standalone.sh', 'c:/Program Files/JBoss/bin/standalone.bat'.
Provide the XML config file if you want to start your server with a different configuration.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the absolute physical path of the domain script, i.e: 'domain.bat', '/usr/tools/bin/domain.sh', 'c:/Program Files/JBoss/bin/domain.bat'.

For domain controllers only. Name of the domain configuration file that ElectricFlow uses to start the domain controller with a different domain configuration (--domain-config). By default domain.xml is used.

For domain and host controllers. Name of the host configuration file that ElectricFlow uses to start the domain or host controller with a different host configuration (--host-config). By default host.xml is used.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration holds information about the domain you want to start.

Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration holds information about the standalone server you want to shut down. The IP and port are supplied by the configuration. If left blank, default controller values (IP and port) will be used for the shutdown attempt.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.

procedure.description: For Standalone and Domain. The DeployApp procedure deploys an application (mainly WAR or EAR) from the specified source (usually from filepath) to standalone server (for Standalone JBoss) or to content repository and specified server groups (for Domain JBoss) based on provided parameters. This procedure is build around jboss-cli command 'deploy' and most parameters are corresponding.

formalParameter.description: A unique name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for the plugin.

Stands for 'file_path' parameter for jboss-cli 'deploy' command, but it is also possible to provide '--url' parameter here for JBoss EAP 7 and later versions. In case of 'file_path' - pass full filesystem path to the application to deploy, e.g. '/tmp/hello-world.war'. In case of '--url' (for EAP 7 and later) - pass URL at which the deployment content is available (in this case should include prefix anchor '--url=', e.g. '--url=https://my.site.com/hello-world.war').
Provide the physical location of the jboss Command Line Interface (CLI) script, i.e: 'jboss-cli.bat', '/path/to/jboss-cli.sh'. If omitted, script location from configuration will be used.

Stands for '--name' parameter for jboss-cli 'deploy' command. The unique name of the deployment. If this parameter is not provided then JBoss will retrieve the deployment name from the file name of 'file_path' or '--url'.

Stands for '--runtime-name' parameter for jboss-cli 'deploy' command. The runtime name for the deployment. NOTE: the file extension (.war, .jar, .ear etc.) needs to be included into runtime name so server can distinguish type of deployment somehow. This would typically be the same as '--name', and if not specified the value used for '--name' will be used.

Stands for '--force' parameter for jboss-cli 'deploy' command. NOTE: in case of JBoss Domain if this parameter is chosen then 'Apply to all servers' and 'Server groups to apply' will be ignored. Chose this option in order to force the replacement of the existing deployment with the one specified in 'file_path' or '--url', see required 'Source with application for deploy' parameter. If 'Force deployment' is Off and the deployment with the specified deployment name (see 'Deployment name' parameter) already exists - deploy will fail and the corresponding message will printed.

For Domain only (will be ignored in case of Standalone). Stands for '--all-server-groups' parameter for jboss-cli 'deploy' command. NOTE: this parameter will be ignored if 'Force deployment' is chosen; 'Server groups to apply' will be ignored if this parameter is chosen. This parameter indicates that deploy should apply to all the available server groups.

For Domain only (will be ignored in case of Standalone). Stands for '--server-groups' parameter for jboss-cli 'deploy' command. NOTE: this parameter will be ignored if 'Apply to all servers' or 'Force deployment' is chosen. Provide comma separated list of server group names the deploy command should apply to.

Additional options for jboss-cli 'deploy' command. The 'Additional options' string will be concatenated to already generated command line from the parameters above. NOTE: for JBoss EAP 7 and later do not specify '--url' option here because we have special handling for such option within 'Source with application for deploy' parameter.

procedure.description: Undeploys a deployment with the given name and, depending on the arguments, removes its content from the repository.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to undeploy.
Select this option to disable the deployment and keep the content of the deployment, or unselect it to disable the deployment and removes its content from the repository.

Select this option to apply undeploy to all server groups in which the deployment is enabled. Either server-groups or all-relevant-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode.
Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the undeploy command applies to.
Additional options for undeployapp command.

procedure.description: Check the HTTP status of a given URL

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Provide a host name to check. Applicable only for domain mode and will be ignored for standalone server.
Provide a server name to check. Applicable only for domain mode and will be ignored for standalone server..

A desired status of the server. The procedure fails if criteria is not met. If "Perform URL check" is not set: only terminal status 'running' for standalone and 'STARTED' for domain meet RUNNING criteria.
Wait time for terminal status in seconds. If not provided, only one check will be performed. If 0, it will wait until criteria is met. Default 300.
Select this option to check JBoss server url for availability instead of checking terminal status with jboss-cli.

procedure.description: Check the HTTP status of a given URL

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to enable.
Serversgroup.
Servers.
Success Criteria.
Wait time.
Hosts list.

procedure.description: Enables an already existing but disabled in the repository deployment designated by the name argument. Implemented only for the Standalone Mode.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to enable.

Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the enable deployment command applies to. Server groups parameter is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode and will be ignored.

procedure.description: Disables a deployment designated by the name argument. Implemented only for the Standalone Mode.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to disable.

Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the disable deployment command applies to. Server groups parameter is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode and will be ignored.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Application name.
Profile name for domain mode.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
The JDBC driver connection URL. i.e., 'jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/ectest'.
The fully qualifed name of the JDBC driver class. i.e., 'com.mysql.jdbc.Driver'.
Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource. This should start with either java:/ or java:jboss/. i.e., 'java:jboss/datasources/MySql'.

Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. This can be either the name of the .jar file or the name of the module, depending on how the driver has been deployed. i.e., 'mysql-connector-java-5.1.20-bin.jar'.
Specify credential that contains username and password for data source.
Specifies if the datasource should be enabled after creation.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Profile name for domain mode.
Datasource name to delete.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Custom command to run.
Property to write response from JBoss. Example: "/myJob/RunCustomCommandResult"
Choose the format to represent retrieved data. Data can be represented as XML, JSON, raw (just stdout) or property sheet (hierarchy).

procedure.description: For Domain only. The StartServers procedure starts the servers in the specified server group and checks if these servers are started successfully. This procedure is build around jboss-cli command 'start-servers' for the server groups, e.g. '/server-group=some-group-name:start-servers'. Check of servers statuses is done also with help of cli - basically the procedure checks 'status' attributes of needed servers on needed hosts (within specified server group), e.g. '/host=some-host-name/server-config=some-server-name:read-attribute(name=status)'. Expected value for started servers is 'STARTED'.

formalParameter.description: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for the plugin.
Provide the physical location of the jboss Command Line Interface (CLI) script, i.e: 'jboss-cli.bat', '/path/to/jboss-cli.sh'. If omitted, script location from configuration will be used.
The name of the server group to start. The following cli command will be called: e.g. if 'some-group-name' is specified then '/server-group=some-group-name:start-servers' is called.

After start-servers command for the server group is called the procedure starts performing recurring check of servers if they are started ('status' attribute is 'STARTED', see procedure description). Delay between each check is 5 seconds (hard coded value). Check will be performed only one time if the timeout is not specified or it is less than 5 seconds. Default is 300 seconds.

procedure.description: For Domain only. The StopServers procedure stops the servers in the specified server group and checks if these servers are stopped successfully. This procedure is build around jboss-cli command 'stop-servers' for the server groups, e.g. '/server-group=some-group-name:stop-servers'. Check of servers statuses is done also with help of cli - basically the procedure checks 'status' attributes of needed servers on needed hosts (within specified server group), e.g. '/host=some-host-name/server-config=some-server-name:read-attribute(name=status)'. Expected value for stopped servers is 'STOPPED' or 'DISABLED' (similar statuses which indicate that servers are stopped, the difference is that 'DISABLED' status indicates that a server is configured to not start automatically while 'STOPPED' status indicates that a server is configured to start automatically).

formalParameter.description: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for the plugin.
Provide the physical location of the jboss Command Line Interface (CLI) script, i.e: 'jboss-cli.bat', '/path/to/jboss-cli.sh'. If omitted, script location from configuration will be used.
The name of the server group to stop. The following cli command will be called: e.g. if 'some-group-name' is specified then '/server-group=some-group-name:stop-servers' is called.

After stop-servers command for the server group is called the procedure starts performing recurring check of servers if they are started ('status' attribute is 'STOPPED' or 'DISABLED', see procedure description). Delay between each check is 5 seconds (hard coded value). Check will be performed only one time if the timeout is not specified or it is less than 5 seconds. Default is 300 seconds.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Specifies the command to run.
Specifies the criteria to check.
Wait time.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Name of the host controller. Information is available at host.xml file. Default is 'master'.
Success Criteria
Wait time
